Bounce one check, and your shits on the front lawn.” Looking at me, she said, “Clean up after yourself, I’m not going to be your maid. If you see something in the fridge with my name on it, that means, if you want any, you've got to go out and buy it yourself."

As I followed her down the hall, I started to worry that I’d bitten off more than I chewed. Caitlin didn’t seem to be a very cheerful person. As we arrived outside a closed door, I said, “It seems like we’ve gotten off on the wrong foot.” Smiling, I said, “I’d like for us to be friends.”

Caitlin grumbled as she opened the door; walking back down the hall to another room. I jumped a bit as she slammed the door shut. Looking inside the room, I saw almost a dozen boxes scattered around a brand new mattress. I guess Caitlin wasn’t interested in unpacking for me either. Good thing they labeled all the boxes, I thought as I opened up the first box.. What a difference L.A. is from New Jersey.
1111111113111111111111111111111.title: Los Angeles

11111111131111111111111111111111.content:
I spent a few hours unpacking my boxes but only managed to get through half of them before I decided to take a break. I was bringing some crushed boxes out to the trash when I saw Caitlin, looking more presentable then she had earlier. I watched as she walked past me on the way to her car. Looking at me, she said, “I’m going into work for a few hours; if you have to leave, make sure to lock up. I placed a set of keys on your dresser.”

Desperate to have a positive relationship with this woman, I said, “What do you do for a living, Caitlin?”

Caitlin groaned for a moment before she said, “I’m a digital designer for Paramount; I help design the posters you see at movie theaters.” Sighing, she said, “That’s actually why I’ve got to go into work; my boss doesn’t care for a poster I worked up for the new Tom Cruise movie.”

I wanted to continue the conversation but Caitlin got in her car and drove off. I couldn’t shake the feeling that she didn’t like me very much. Walking back into the house, I said closed the door as I heard my cell phone ringing in my room. Running upstairs, I saw that Leslie was calling me. Answering it, I said, “Hey Leslie.”

“That doesn’t sound like the voice of someone who just started a new life.” Concerned, Leslie said, “What’s wrong, Amelia?”

“I don’t think my roommate likes me very much.” I then went into a 15-minute speech about how rude and abrupt Caitlin had been ever since I arrived. When I was finished, I said, “I know we just met and everything, but I’ve got to say I wish I knew how to make this girl like me.”

“Just take it slowly, Amelia; you don’t want to scare her off.” Pausing, Leslie said, “In the meantime, don’t worry so much about Caitlin; you’re in Los Angeles, why don’t you go see the sights or something.”

“I suppose I could do that; after all, I’ve always wanted to come out here on vacation.” Sitting on the bed, I said, “Not that I don’t mind the call; but I doubt you called just to say hi.”

“Your former family placed an obituary in the local paper this morning; we didn’t realize it until after you already left.” Sighing,
Leslie said, “I’ll email it to you, but the basic gist is that Kevin died suddenly in his sleep.”

“Wow, I know this was all last minute; but you think they could’ve come up with a better cause of death?”

“Feel free to discuss that with them.” Pausing, Leslie said, “I’ll talk to you later, honey; go enjoy the sights.”

After hanging up the phone, I decided to take Leslie up on her suggestion. So I changed out of the skirt suit and into a pair of shorts and a t-shirt. Grabbing everything I’d need for a day on the town, I locked up the house and drove towards downtown.
11111111131111111111111111111111.title: Settling In

111111111311111111111111111111111.content:
It was just after Noon and I was casually strolling along the Venice Beach Boardwalk. I’d visited a few of the major tourist spots; like the Walk of Fame and the Chinese Theater. I was starting to get a little hungry so I crossed the street to a small café.

After giving my order, a small chicken salad with an iced tea, I couldn’t help but do some people watching. I was well aware of the fact that I was now a heterosexual woman, but there were still times when I was surprised to find myself checking out some random guy as he walked by.

My food came 10 minutes later; I had just taken a sip of my iced tea when I heard a voice next to me say, “Well hello again.”

Looking up I saw the guy from the airport; before I could stop myself, I dropped my tea on the ground. Already mortified beyond belief, I became more so when I saw that some of my drink had gotten on his shoes. Grabbing my napkin, I reached down and started wiping it off while a server came to clean up my mess. “Oh my God, I’m so sorry.”

“It’s okay, don’t worry about it.” Gently grabbing my hand, the man said, “These are just a cheap pair of sneakers; who cares if they get dirty.”

As the man took a seat across from me, I sat back down and said, “I’m usually not that clumsy.”

“Don’t worry; stuff like this happens all the time.” Chuckling, the man said, “To be honest, I’d rather have iced tea on my shoes than have someone’s coffee on my shirt.”

A server brought me a new iced tea; as I continued eating my lunch while we talked. After hearing about Leslie’s experience on her first date, I was glad the salad gave me something to do while he spoke. The more I looked at him, the more I realized why other girls thought he was so attractive. “I’ve been watching your show since High School; I’d be lying if I said I didn’t have a little crush on you back then.” With a smile, I wiped some dressing on my face and said, “If someone told me that I’d be sitting at a café chatting with Malcolm Tucker, I would have thought them insane.”

Taking a sip from his soda, Malcolm smiled and said, “So you’re a fan of the show?”

I felt bad about lying to the guy; even if it was only about some minor details. Looking at him, I said, “Yeah, I’ve never missed an episode.” Pausing, I said, “It amazes me how the writers have been able to keep it so fresh after 10 seasons.”

“There have been some instances where storylines were reused; but yeah, I guess they have done a decent job.” Sighing, Malcolm said, “It’s still a lot of fun working on the show; but to be honest, I’m getting tired. My contract came up for renegotiation last month; I’ve kind of been stalling about whether or not to renew it.”

The idea of the show coming to an end didn’t sit well with me, but I couldn’t blame the guy for getting fatigued. Looking at Malcolm, I said, “If you don’t mind me asking, what would you like to do after the show ends?”

“I just finished filming a movie last month; it comes out around Thanksgiving.” Sighing, Malcolm said, “If it’s successful, I’d like to transition to the big screen.”

Thinking back to what Malcolm had said about his enjoyment from working on the show, I recalled my encounter with his costar at the airport. “I have to admit; after bumping into your costar at the airport, it’s hard to believe working with her could be fun.”

“Did Elena leave you with a bad first impression?” looking at me, Malcolm said, “I’m sorry about that, but she’s a really sweet person once you get to know her.”

I couldn’t help but chuckle at that idea. “Sorry, but what chance does a small-town girl from New Jersey have to get to know a TV star.”

“We’ve been talking for almost an hour; so I’d say the chances are really good.” Pausing, Malcolm said, “It just dawned on me that you know who I am, but I don’t know who you are.”

“Let’s remedy that, shall we?” extending my hand, I said, “My name’s Amelia Webber.”

Shaking my hand, Malcolm said, “It’s nice to meet you, Amelia.” Looking past me, he said, “What do you know, it looks like you’ll get a chance to meet Elena after all.”

Turning around, I saw Elena Johnson walking towards us; her demeanor much different from when I’d encountered her at the airport.
111111111311111111111111111111111.title: Seeing the Sights

1111111113111111111111111111111111.content:
Walking up to the table, Elena said, “How are you doing, Mal? Did you make a new - Oh, my God!"

I watched as all color drained from Elena’s face; which led to a smirk, and a wink, from Malcolm. “I take it then that you remember Amelia?”

“I’m sorry about this morning.” Taking a seat next to me, Elena placed a hand on my shoulder and said, “I’m not the biggest fan of flying; so I can get rather testy, and my PMDD doesn’t help at all.”

I’d never heard of that before now, it wasn’t something Kelsey experienced to my knowledge. “PMDD?”

“Yeah, it stands for premenstrual dysphoric disorder; imagine the worst period you’ve ever had, and multiply that by 50 for me.” Sighing, Elena said, “I was a walking time bomb this morning; unfortunately you found yourself in my crosshairs. I’m sorry about that, miss... I'm sorry what did you say your name was?"

While silently hoping I never experienced PMDD, I couldn’t stop thinking about how I’d only been in LA for a few hours and I was already on a first-name basis with two celebrities. “Amelia Webber.”

“My name’s Elena Johnson, but I suspect you already know that.” Looking at me, she said, “Thanks for not going to TMZ after our first meeting, Amelia.”

“Don’t worry, that was the last thing on my mind this morning.” Sighing, I said, “I just moved out here from New Jersey, so I was more focused on getting settled.”

His interest piqued, Malcolm said, “What brings you out here from Jersey?”

“Work; I’m hoping to get into the entertainment industry.” Seeing a flash of concern across Elena’s face, I turned to her and said, “Don’t worry; I’m going for something behind the scenes, I’ve got an interview at a talent agency tomorrow morning.”
While Elena breathed a sigh of relief, Malcolm said, “Really? What agency?”

At that moment I forgot the name of the agency; try as I might, I couldn’t remember it. “You know what, I-I’ve completely blanked on the name.”

“Not a problem, I hope you nail the interview.” Smiling, Elena said, “What were you guys talking about when I showed up?”

“Nothing major, just my plans for once the show’s over.”

“Look at you, Mr. Big Shot with your big screen movie.” Groaning, Elena said, “All I’ve got is a role in some Christmas movie on Hallmark Channel.”

“Hey it’s a start, right?” pausing, I said, “What's it about?”

“It’s a Christmas movie on the Hallmark Channel, so the same thing as every other movie they’ve done.” Sighing, Elena said, “Some big-shot executive, with an 8-figure salary, returns home and throws it all away to be with some boy she knew in High School. I play the part of the guy’s kid sister; who fixes them up."

“Hey if Kevin Bacon and Holly Hunter can get their start being killed in slasher movies, you can make a Hallmark Christmas movie."

With a smile, Elena said, “You sound just like my agent."

“I’m not there yet, but that’s the dream.”

As the three of us continued talking, I began to notice something: when I was talking, Malcolm was focused on my lips. When he, or Elena, spoke he would look at me – not just my boobs and butt, the way so many men had, but all{/i) of me.

We kept talking until my salad and iced tea were gone, and then we went our separate ways.
1111111113111111111111111111111111.title: Two Celebrities & A Girl From Jersey

11111111131111111111111111111111111.content:
It was just after 4:00 when I decided it was time to head back home; having just done a tour of the Queen Mary museum in Long Beach. As I drove onto the freeway, I found myself remembering that LA was notorious for rush hour traffic; and hoped I didn’t have an issue.

Thankfully I didn’t experience much in the way of traffic; getting back to the house just before 5:00 to find that Caitlin’s car was in the driveway. As I got out of the car, I remembered my desire to have a friendship with Caitlin. After locking my car, I walked up to the front door and let myself inside.

The moment I did, I heard Caitlin’s voice coming from down the hall; it sounded like she was talking to someone. Going down the hall, I found Caitlin spread out in the breakfast nook having a conversation with someone over the phone. “She seems like a nice enough girl, Mom; but after what happened with Carly, I want to exercise some caution.” Looking up from the phone, Caitlin saw me standing in the doorway. Throwing me a wave, she returned to the phone call, “No Mom, I haven’t spoken with Carly or Brandon since they moved out; and frankly I don’t know if want to.”

Feeling thirsty, I walked over to the fridge and opened it; grabbing a can of diet coke from the door. As I opened it, I heard Caitlin say, “I’ll talk to you later, Mom; I’ve got to start making dinner.”

After she hung up the phone, I looked at her and said, “I didn’t mean to eavesdrop on your conversation.”

“It’s alright.” Getting up, Caitlin placed the phone back on the charger. “I’m making chicken tetrazzini for dinner, you want some?”

“Sure, that sounds nice.” As Caitlin walked by me, I said, “About this morning; I want us to be friends, but I couldn’t help but feel we got off on the wrong foot.”

“Let’s not rush into things, Amelia; I’ve been burned because of that before.” Looking at me, Caitlin said, “You seem like a nice girl, but I think we should get to know each other a little better.”

“Does that cautious attitude have anything to do with Carly or Brandon?”

Caitlin looked me; a look of anger briefly flashing across her face. “Carly was my college roommate, and Brandon was my boyfriend.” Sighing, Caitlin said, “The three of us lived here, together, for three years; until I found out that they’d been sleeping with each other behind my back.”

“Oh; I guess I can understand you're being cautious around me then.” Looking at Caitlin, I said, “I’m not the kind of girl to sleep with someone’s boyfriend, so you don’t have to worry about that.”

********************************


The dinner took about an hour to make, even with some help from me. She was still somewhat reserved, but Caitlin had opened up a little bit. The two of us were sitting at the table, eating and talking. “You know a decent amount about me, Amelia; but I don’t know anything about you.” Looking at me, taking a bite, Caitlin said, “Why don’t you tell me about yourself?”

“There’s not much to tell, really; I’m from New Jersey and I’m the first in my family to go to college.” Sighing, I said, “I wasn’t happy with the life I had back east, so I went to New Horizons and they helped me get my life back on track.”

“I’ve only heard a little bit about what they do, something about making changes to a person’s life or something like that.” Chuckling, Caitlin said, “I honestly never gave them much thought until one of their reps came by, offering me $1500 a month to let you live here.”

“So if they’re giving you $1500 a month, shouldn’t that more than cover my rent?”

“Wow, you don’t beat around the bush; do you.” Putting her fork down, Caitlin said, “I’ll tell you what; let’s see how things go for the next few weeks. If we don’t kill each other, I’ll put the $1500 towards your monthly rent; all you’ll have to do is chip in some money for utilities and groceries. How’s that sound?”

With a smile on my face, I nodded and said. “I think I can live with that.”

“Since you’ve asked me some personal questions, I hope you don’t mind if I do the same.” Looking at me, Caitlin said, “What exactly did New Horizons do to help you get your life back on track? Pay off your debt? Take care of some legal troubles?”

I was hesitant to come clean about this so early, but I figured there was no harm in it. “No, it wasn’t anything like that.” Taking a deep breath, I said, “They changed me from a 14-year-old boy to the 26-year-old woman you see before you.”
11111111131111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home (Getting to Know Caitlin)

111111111311111111111111111111111111.content:
To say that Caitlin was stunned would have been an understatement; she was silent for a good five minutes after I told her the truth, doing nothing but stare at me. I started to feel weirded out, worried that she was going to have a less than positive reaction. When she finally spoke again, she said, “You’re kidding, right?” looking at me, she said, “There’s no possible way you could’ve been a 14-year-old boy.”

“Caitlin, I promise I’m telling the truth.” Looking at her, I said, “I was extremely unhappy in my former life, bordering on the suicidal, so my former family brought me to New Horizons. After answering some questions, and being injected with some nanites, I became the woman you see before you.”

I then went on to explain the process I went through to become Amelia; from the interview to the psychological evaluation and life design to the procedure itself. By the time I was finished, Caitlin was pacing around the kitchen floor. “Let’s say I believe you, which I don’t by the way; why would a 14-year-old boy decide to give up 12 years of his life and become a woman?”

“I’ll be honest, I didn’t give that much thought; I just figured I’d try for something completely different from my former life.” With a slight grin, I said, “What could be more different than becoming a 26-year-old woman.”

“Forgive me if this is at all inappropriate, but I just have to ask.” Walking over to me, Caitlin knelt in front of me and said, “Are you... how should I put this, 100% female?”

“I’m as much a woman as you are; right down to my ovaries and my uterus.” With a pause, I said, “As a matter of fact, I’m due for my first period in a few days.”

After that, Caitlin asked me a few more questions before I went upstairs to retrieve the photos I’d gotten from Kelsey. As she looked at them, Caitlin said, “I chickened out on getting a tattoo, but here you went through such a dramatic transformation.” Putting the photos down, she said, “That must’ve been hard to leave your family.”

“It was, but we all knew where I could’ve ended up had I not gone through with this.” Gathering up the photos, I said, “That’s not to say I’ll never see them again; I’ll wait a few months before I fly back to see them.”

When Caitlin looked at me now, I saw no hint of the girl I’d first met this morning. Taking a seat next to me, Caitlin said, “I know we just met, but it means a lot that you trusted me with your story.”

“I’m glad you took it all in stride; I was worried that you’d react negatively.” Breathing a sigh of relief, I said, “It’s nice to have someone, out here, who I can talk to.”

“This is California, girl; and it’s the 21st century.” Looking at me, a smile on her face, Caitlin said, “Our state motto could be changed to ‘Cool, yo' and no one would bat an eye.”

“It still means a lot that you’re so understanding about this.”

“There is one thing I’m curious about; you’ve only been a woman for a few days, right?”

I wasn’t sure where Caitlin was going with this so, looking perplexed, I said, “Yeah, it’ll be 5 days tomorrow. Why?”

“How much do you know about being a woman?” looking at me, she said, “I can’t imagine you knew very much going in.”

“During the procedure, they gave me all the basic knowledge I’d need; hair and makeup, how to handle a bra and walking in heels.” Sighing, I said, “I’ve got a lot to learn about flirting; and, as one my girlfriends would say, I can’t hold my alcohol yet.”

“I’m not sure I can help you with the flirting; especially considering what happened with my last boyfriend.” Getting up, Caitlin retrieved a bottle of wine and some glasses. Walking back over to me, she said, “But I think I can help you with the second; what do you say to some inexpensive wine and a chick flick?”

With a grin and a chuckle, I said, “That’s the best idea I’ve heard all day.”
111111111311111111111111111111111111.title: Caitlin's Disbelief

1111111113111111111111111111111111111.content:
Caitlin and I stayed up watching movies until shortly after 10:00. Okay, so maybe the movies were playing in the background while we drank wine and talked. We both spoke about our childhoods and families; I wouldn’t say we were friends yet, but I figured we were well on our way.

When I woke up the next morning to my alarm clock, I found that I didn’t feel as hung-over as I had previously. After making a mental note to stick with wine instead of hard liquor, I climbed out of bed and made my way to the bathroom.

I was about to step into the shower when I heard a commotion outside; going over to the window, I noticed a handful of older children getting onto a waiting school bus. I then remembered that today would’ve been Kevin’s first day back at school; I couldn’t help but wonder how things would go for Kelsey and my friends now that word of my ‘death’ had gotten out.

I then reminded myself that that was no longer my concern; Kevin’s life was behind me now, I was living Amelia’s life. As I climbed into the shower, my thoughts turned to my interview this morning and I’ll admit that I was a tad nervous.

***********************


I walked into the kitchen about 30 minutes later; looking professional in my new skirt suit and heels. Caitlin was standing over by the coffee maker; looking up at me, she smiled and said, “Wow, you weren’t kidding about them giving you everything you’d need to be a woman.” With a chuckle, she said, “I’ve been a woman my entire life; I’ve never gotten my hair or makeup to look remotely as good as yours.”

“I guess they wanted to give me every advantage they could.” Walking over to the counter, I said, “Do you mind if I borrow one of our travel mugs for the day?”

“Go right ahead; I’ve got plenty of them.” Watching as I filled one of the mugs with coffee, Caitlin said, “How are you feeling about the interview?”

“I’m feeling hopeful, and a little nervous.” Putting the lid on the mug, I said, “I’ve never been to an interview before, so I have no idea what I’m walking into.”

“I’ll tell you what I tell people when they’re auditioning; just take it one step at a time.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Caitlin said, “You’ve got this, Amelia.”

“Thanks.” Noticing the time, I said, “I should probably get going; I don’t want to get stuck in traffic.”

As I started walking out of the room, Caitlin called out, “Why don’t you stop by the studio afterward; we can get an early lunch and I’ll show you around.”

The thought of getting a behind the scenes tour of a major studio was appealing. Turning around in the doorway, I said, “I’d like that.”

“Great, I’ll give your name to security so they’ll let you in.” with a smile, Caitlin said, “Good luck.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

11111111131111111111111111111111111111.content:
The talent agency took up three floors of a 10 story office building downtown; I was sitting in a well-lit waiting room with several other people, including a man and two other women. The longer I sat there, the more anxious I started to get – I began to wonder if the others in the room could tell I wasn’t what I seemed. I then reminded myself that that was absurd; after all, I was both physically and mentally a woman.

My interview was the second to last one; both the man and one of the women were called in before me. I started to get nervous again, this time because of the interview itself. It didn’t help that the man came out of the room drenched in sweat. He’s not getting the job. To help with my anxiety, I decided to strike up a conversation with the other woman.

Getting up, I walked over and sat down next to her, “I don’t know about you, but I’m pretty nervous about all of this.”

The woman, a slightly younger woman of Asian descent, turned to face me. I was taken aback when I saw the look of contempt on her face. “I’m not nervous at all; one call from my father and I can get any job I want in this town.”

That was all I needed to hear to know that this woman was incredibly spoiled; she was probably only interviewing for the job because her ‘daddy’ was making her. I didn’t want to be rude, but I also didn’t want to talk with her. Getting up, with a fake smile,
I said, “Well good luck.”

Thankfully I didn’t have long to wait; barely a minute after I got back to my seat, the second candidate came walking down the hall along with another young woman. After thanking the candidate for coming, the woman looked into the room. “Amelia Webber?”

Here goes nothing. Getting to my feet, I said, “That’s me, I’m Amelia Webber.”

“Follow me, please.”

************************************


I took it as a good sign that my interview lasted longer than the first two combined; although I was still incredibly nervous the entire time. The woman I was interviewing with, Meredith Geller, was slightly older than my…rather Kevin’s mom had been. The position I was interviewing for was to be her assistant.

The whole time I was answering questions, I feared that she would realize my degrees and job experience were faked. To be fair, the job experience was faked but the degrees were real.

I had just finished answering one of those ‘where do you see yourself in 5 years’ questions; saying that I hoped to become a talent agent as well, maybe eventually open an agency of my own someday. For some reason or another, Meredith liked my answer. “Well, I’ve got all the information I need.” Getting to her feet, Meredith reached out her hand and said, “You’ve got the job, Ms. Webber.”

To say that I was relieved would be an understatement; all my anxiety and nervousness had been for naught. After realizing that I’d gone almost a minute without responding, I quickly grabbed Meredith’s hand and said, “Thank you so much, ma’am; you won’t be disappointed.”

The two of us walked out of the room; where she introduced me to the woman I’d be replacing. By pure coincidence, the spoiled woman from before was walking out of the nearby bathroom when Meredith said, “Brianna; I’d like for you to meet your replacement, Amelia Webber.”

As Brianna got to her feet, I swear I saw the other woman giving me a death stare. She turned and walked out in a huff, while Brianna said, “It’s a pleasure to meet you, Amelia.”

“The pleasure’s all mine, Brianna.”

Looking at the two of us, Meredith said, “Brianna is leaving us for an administrative job at Pixar; she’s leaving some big shoes to fill, but I’m sure you’re up to the task Amelia.”

I stayed for a few more minutes; chatting with Brianna and learning that my training would start on Monday. I was grateful for that because it gave me four days to relax beforehand. After once again, thanking Meredith I gathered my things and left.

I knew she was probably busy, so I decide to simply text Leslie – I got the job! Getting into my car, I plugged in the address for Paramount and drove off for my lunch with Caitlin.
11111111131111111111111111111111111111.title: The Interview

111111111311111111111111111111111111111.content:
Thanks to some late-morning traffic, what should have been a 20-minute drive turned into an almost 40 minute one. I’d become mildly annoyed by the traffic by time I drove through the gate at Paramount. After giving my name to the guard, I was given directions to where I needed to go.

I parked my car in one of the visitor spots outside of Caitlin’s office and walked inside. After taking the elevator up to Caitlin’s floor, I walked up to the receptionist. Trying my best to look professional, I said, “My name’s Amelia Webber, I’m here to see Caitlin Saunders.”

“I’m afraid Ms. Saunders doesn’t take walk-ins, ma’am.” Looking at me, the receptionist said, “I can give you her number if you’d like to make an appointment for an audition.”

I was a little annoyed by the thought that I was someone walking in from the streets in the hopes of getting an audition. “Sorry, I think there’s been a mistake; I’m not here for an audition. I’m Caitlin’s roommate; we’re having lunch together.”

The receptionist went pale as a ghost, as if she’d made a horrible mistake, “I’m so sorry, ma’am; I’ll let her know you’re here.”

I took a seat in the waiting area while I waited for Caitlin to come out. The receptionist, probably trying to make up for her mistake, offered me water but I politely declined. I was only waiting a few minutes before Caitlin walked down the hall. Upon seeing me, a smile on her face, she came over and hugged me.

After exchanging pleasantries, she led me down the hall to her office. While we were walking, she turned to me and said, “How’d the interview go?”

With a smile on my face, I said, “I nailed it, I start training on Monday.”

“Girl I knew you were going to nail that interview.” Stepping in her office, which was a pretty decent size, Caitlin said, “Why don’t you have a seat; I just have to send out some emails and then we’ll go to lunch.”

As I took a seat, I said, “I’m not that hungry yet; I was wondering if we could take that tour first.”

Looking up from her computer, Caitlin said, “It’s totally up to you, we’ll do whatever you feel like.”
111111111311111111111111111111111111111.title: Paramount Studios

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The more I thought about it, the more I realized that I was getting pretty hungry; after all, I was so nervous this morning that I hadn’t eaten breakfast. “On second thought I could go for some lunch, then perhaps we can do the tour after.”

“That works for me.” Grabbing her purse and phone, Caitlin said, “If we hurry, we might run into some of the actors at the commissary.”

The thought of seeing even more celebrities appealed to me, as I followed Caitlin down the hall to the elevator. As we waited for the elevator to arrive, I decided to pass the time by regaling Caitlin with the story of my encounter with that woman at the interview. “I’m sure you probably see people like this all the time; but while I was waiting for my turn to be interviewed, I decided to strike up a conversation with this other woman in the waiting room.” sighing, I said, “When I asked her if she was nervous, she told me that her father could get her any job she wanted with just a phone call.”

“Oh god, I hate people like that; they’re so spoiled.” The elevator arrived at that moment. As we walked inside, Caitlin said, “I remember, last year, auditioning this teenager for a spot on some reality TV that didn’t even make it to air. She was terrible but I had to give her an audition because her father was some big executive.”

“It amazes me that people think that’s how the world works; that they’ll get anything they want solely because of who they’re related to.”

“I know it’s not exactly the same, but you’re only out here because you went to New Horizons.” Looking at me, as the elevator started its descent, Caitlin said, “If you hadn’t become a woman and moved out here, who knows who could have gotten that job.”

As I stood there I realized that, in a way, Caitlin was correct. The big reason I got this new job was that I went to New Horizons. Then again, they just changed me and gave me the necessary education; I was the one that wowed Meredith at the interview. Looking at her, I said, “You don’t think I’m like that other woman, do you?”

The gravity of what she said must’ve dawned on Caitlin; as her eyes went wide and she looked at me. “Not exactly; sure you got that job with help from someone else, but you’re nothing like that other woman.” With a short pause, Caitlin said, “At least from what little I’ve seen, and heard about your former life, you’re the polar opposite of that woman.”

I couldn’t shake the feeling that Caitlin didn’t believe that; that she actually thought I was in the same boat as that other woman. But in an attempt to change the conversation, and keep the two of us from arguing in an elevator, I said, “So what’s the food like here?”

“It’s extremely overpriced, but it’s actually quite good.” Looking at me, Caitlin said, “I can guarantee it’s better than anything you’d get for lunch at school.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading to Lunch

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As it turned out, Caitlin was right on both counts; the food was overpriced ($8 for a pre-made salad and a drink) but it was still better than anything I’d ever had at school. The two of us had a conversation between bites; mostly idle conversation but I did learn a little more about her.

“What made you want to get involved in casting?”

Taking a sip of her soda, Caitlin looked at me and said, “I was a bit of a theater geek in high school; I helped out with pretty much every aspect of production.” Taking a breath, Caitlin continued, “I wasn’t the best actress, but I was great behind the scenes; so once college started I decide to major in film production.”

“Did you ever regret not getting any formal acting training?”

“Nope, none at all; I’m perfectly happy with my career. I’m pretty sure I’m on the shortlist to replace my boss when he retires next year.” Sighing, Caitlin said, “Really the only regret I have is staying with my ex for 5 years.”

I thought back to the terrible luck my mom had dating after my dad left; a lot of her dates bailed the moment they learned she had two young kids. I couldn’t help but feel bad for Caitlin having put all that time and effort into a relationship, only for her ex to cheat on her. “He couldn’t have been that bad; after all, you were together for 5 years.”

“This coming from a former 14-year-old boy who, on her first day as a woman, thought it would be wise to strip in front of half a dozen children.”

I knew that little story would come back to bite me; I just figured it would take longer. Taking a deep breath, I said, “First off; I was drunk. Secondly; there were only two kids at the pool.”

It looked as if Caitlin was about to say something else; until she got all jumpy for a moment. “Don’t look now, but a very cute guy just walked into the room.”

Thinking that perhaps it was a co-worker of Caitlin’s that she liked, I turned around to look; only to discover that it was Malcolm. The sight of him walking through the buffet line caused me to blush. I don’t know what came over me, but I stood up and hollered, “Malcolm!”

Everyone in the room turned to face me; as Caitlin, looking mortified, grabbed me and pulled me back into my seat. “What are you doing!? He’s an actor, you can’t just...”

Caitlin stopped midsentence as Malcolm stopped in front of our table. With a smile on his face, Malcolm looked at me and said, “Hey Amelia, I didn’t expect to see you here.”

Caitlin’s expression quickly changed from embarrassed to shock; as she just stared at Malcolm and me. Once she got her voice back, her mouth agape, she said, “You’re on a first-name basis with Malcolm Tucker; star of Double Trouble.”

Taking a seat at our table, Malcolm said, “We met at the airport yesterday; she dropped her passport and I retrieved it for her.” With a grin, he said, “Then we met again at a café in Venice Beach, where she slipped a glass of iced tea on my shoes.”

Turning to Caitlin, I said, “After Elena showed up, the three of us spent almost an hour talking with each other.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunch & A Familiar Face

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The three of us sat and talked for about 30 minutes, while Malcolm taking a break from filming some scenes for the show. I suppose I couldn’t blame her, but I couldn’t help but be a little annoyed by her acting like a fangirl. She wouldn’t stop asking Malcolm questions about the show, or other celebrities that he’d worked with.

Malcolm, to his credit, answered every question; but I couldn’t help but notice he was focusing his attention on me. I’d already told him everything the day before, so all that was left was just idle chit-chat.

Eventually, Malcolm’s break came to an end and he went back to the set; but not before taking a quick selfie with Caitlin and me. As Caitlin and I walked out of the commissary a few minutes later, she turned to me and said, “I can’t believe how dull my life was before you showed up.” Stopping in the parking lot, she said, “That’s the longest conversation I’ve had with an actor that wasn’t work-related.”

As we continued walking, I said, “Malcolm seems like a pretty down to earth kind of guy.”

“Plus he was totally flirting with you.”

Now it was my turn to stop; turning to Caitlin, I said, “You’re kidding, right? Malcolm was not flirting with me.”

“He was so flirting with you, Amelia; and, at least subconsciously, I think you were flirting with him as well.” Looking at me, she said, “Forget for a moment that you used to be a teenage boy; have you ever known a guy to spend 30 minutes talking with an attractive woman about the weather?”

The more I thought about it, the more I realized that Caitlin may have a point. With the looks that he'd been giving me yesterday, plus the fact 30 minutes of idle conversation over lunch, there was a distinct possibility that Malcolm was at least interested in me. “Even if we were flirting with each other, he’s way out of my league.” Sighing, as we crossed the road going towards a row of parked golf carts, I said, “He’s an actor and I’m a glorified secretary; I couldn’t get a guy like that in a million years.”

“The heart wants what the heart wants, Amelia.” Taking a seat in one of the carts, Caitlin said, “Mark my words, very soon Malcolm will be asking you on a date.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: After Lunch

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Caitlin and I drove around the studio for around 25 minutes; where I was shown the various soundstages and even got to tour the New York backlot. Eventually, Caitlin’s lunch ended and we returned to her office. As we stood outside, in the parking lot, I turned to her and said, “Thanks for all this, Caitlin; I had fun.”

“I had fun too; this isn’t something I regularly get to do.” looking at me, she said, “Before I head back inside, I need to know; can you cook?”

I was confused by the sudden change of topic, so I was silent for a moment. “What?”

“Can you cook? Because if you can tonight’s your turn.”

After the pleasant lunch I’d had with her, I was taken aback by Caitlin’s sudden change in attitude; similar, but not identical, to when we’d first met. “Yeah, I can cook.” Looking at her, I said, “What’s going on, you were acting all friendly just a few minutes ago. I thought we were becoming friends.”

“Why are you so quick to want to be friends?” stepping towards me, Caitlin said, “We just met yesterday, Amelia; I still need some time to figure out whether I like you or not.”

“You have a funny way of showing that then; inviting me to lunch and giving me a tour of the studio.” Taking a deep breath, trying to maintain my composure, I said, “Why’d you do all that if you didn’t want to be friends?”

“In my line of work, it pays to be on good terms with a talent agent.”

I was wounded; here I thought Caitlin was being nice, but she was only looking to use me. Looking at her, getting a little emotional, I said, “After our talk last night, I would’ve thought you’d realize I don’t like being used.” Taking a deep breath, I said, “I’ll see you when you get home.”

I turned to walk away; leaving Caitlin standing on the steps with a sad look on her face.

*******************************


After getting back to the house, I decided to get my unpacking finished. There wasn’t much left to do, so I was finished within a couple of hours. Once that was finished, I decided to unwind in the sunroom with my laptop and a glass of wine.

It took a few minutes to get the computer set up; but once that was done, I figured now would be a good time to send my family an email. After all, it had been 5 days since I’d left them, so they were probably waiting for me to reach out.

I logged into my new Gmail account and typed in Kelsey’s email address. Once that was done, I thought about what I would say; eventually settling on something short and sweet:

Hey Kelsey,
It’s me...
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later On

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was halfheartedly reading some local news, 20 minutes later, when a message window popped up on my screen. It hadn’t occurred to me until then that communicating by email was my only option. Looking at the window, I saw it was from Kelsey.

Oh my God, I was beginning to think you’d forgotten about us.

It was the moment of truth; would I respond or ignore the message. I, of course, had no intention to simply ignore the message; so I took a deep breath and typed out my response.

Me – Sorry about that; as you might imagine, the last few days have been pretty crazy. How are things back in Jersey?

There was a short pause before Kelsey’s response appeared on the screen. Kelsey – You probably already know about it but Mom placed an obituary in the paper yesterday. We’ve been getting a lot of phone calls and visits from people; including people you probably wouldn’t have expected.

I couldn’t begin to imagine what Mom and Kelsey were going through; knowing that I wasn’t dead. Actually, in a sense, I guess I was – Kevin died on that hospital bed. That must be an awkward situation for you guys to be in; telling people I’m dead when I’m not.

Yeah it is, but it’s a price we’re willing to pay for you to be happy.

That response served to show how much my family loved me, and what they were willing to sacrifice for me. A stray tear rolled down my cheek as I started typing. There’s no way I’ll ever be able to repay you and mom for this.

The conversation remained like that for a short time; as Kelsey caught me up on everything that’s happened since I left. I couldn’t help but think, however, that she was holding something back. I had an idea of what it might be, but I couldn’t prove it until she said: Was that you that I saw parked across the street yesterday morning?

I stared at that message for a moment, taking a sip of my wine while I thought about my response. Taking a deep breath, I reached forward and started typing: Yeah, that was me.

Kelsey didn’t respond for a few moments; likely trying to wrap her head around the fact that I was now a woman. Why did you drive off?

I guess I was nervous; I wasn’t sure how you’d react to the new me.

I always knew there was a possibility that you’d come out of this a woman, but I have to admit, I’m a bit surprised.

I then proceeded to type out a lengthy description of what happened after they dropped me off. I wanted my new life to be different, and being a 26-year-old woman was very different from my old life.

I suppose I shouldn’t fault you for wanting something different. There was a slight pause before another response came through. I didn’t get a very good look at you before you drove off; any chance you could send me a picture?

Every picture I’d taken since yesterday had been uploaded to my computer; so I chose the one of me with the girls from NHI and the one that Malcolm took with me and Caitlin. That last one I sent solely to see how Kelsey would respond. Here are some photos.

After a moment, Kelsey responded. Did you seriously get to meet Malcolm Tucker?

I couldn’t help but chuckle as I wrote my response. That’s right; I bumped into him and Elena Johnson at the airport yesterday. That photo was from earlier today; I was meeting my housemate for lunch and he joined us.

I’m so jealous of you right now. There was another brief pause, followed by another response. You look great in those photos by the way; I can honestly say that’s the first genuine smile I’ve seen you give in a long time. Another pause. I never thought I’d say this about you, but you make an attractive woman.

I looked at the time on my computer and saw that it was almost 3:00; which meant that it was 6:00 for Kelsey. I’m sure Mom’s probably getting dinner ready for you guys; I’ll let you go.

I’ll talk you to later on, Kev...wait, what’s your name now?

Amelia Webber.

I’ll talk to you later, Amelia. Love you.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Chatting with Kelsey

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
About 15 minutes had passed since my conversation with Kelsey. I was still in the sunroom, watching some birds flying around the backyard when I heard my cell phone start to ring. As I reached for it, I saw the caller ID said ‘Mom & Dad.’ With a smile on my face, I answered the call and said, “Hello?”

I was greeted by the cheerful voice of my mother, who said, “Hi sweetie, did I catch you at a bad time?”

I had hoped for a little peace and quiet, but I wasn’t going to tell her that, “No Mom, I’m just relaxing in the sunroom.” Sighing, I said, “I’ve had kind of a stressful day.”

“I thought you sounded a little tense.” Pausing, Mom said, “What’s wrong, honey?”

I felt a smile creep across my face; she may not be my biological mother, but Joanna was certainly treating me like she was. “I nailed my job interview, so my day started out great.” Grabbing my glass of wine, I said, “I met my housemate, Caitlin for lunch; she works over at Paramount. I thought we were making progress towards a friendship, but it turns out she was just using me to further her career.”

I then proceeded to explain everything that’s happened between me and Caitlin since I arrived. That went on for 20 minutes, during which time I would occasionally raise my voice. Once I was finished, Mom said, “While I don’t appreciate anyone treating my daughter like that, I can see where Caitlin is coming from.” Sighing, Mom said, “It sounds like she was quite close to her college roommate; so much so that her faith in people was shattered after she learned of her boyfriend’s infidelity.”

I don’t know why that hadn’t occurred to me until that moment. Now that I saw it from that perspective, I realized that Caitlin’s supposed hostility towards me was just a defense mechanism. “I guess I could give her some space; after all, we did just meet yesterday.” With a chuckle, I said, “I guess I got so caught up in wanting to make new friends, I forgot that some people want to take things slow.”

I heard the front door open at that moment; I turned and caught a glimpse of Caitlin walking down the hall towards the kitchen. I turned my attention back to the phone as Mom started speaking again, “I’m sure you two will become friends in time, just take things slowly.” Pausing, she said, “Before I let you go, sweetie; are you going to be free tomorrow afternoon?”

“I don’t know, I’m still new to Los Angeles so I might want to explore some more.” Getting up from the couch, I said, “Why do you want to know?”

“Your brother and sister are stopping by for your father’s birthday; I figured you’d want to meet them.”

I had a momentary brain cramp until I remembered they were also the ‘parents’ to a teenage boy attending a private school in New York. I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to meet him and my sister. “Sure, why not; I’d love to meet them.”

“Excellent, let’s plan to have a video call around 3:30 your time.” Pausing, Mom said, “I’ll see you tomorrow, sweetie.”

As I walked into the kitchen, I said, “Talk to you later mom, love you.”

Once I ended the call, Caitlin looked at me and said, “I assume that wasn’t Kevin’s mom you were talking with.”

“You’d assume correctly, although I did have a chat with my sister earlier.” Placing my things on the counter, I said, “Look, about what happened at the studio...”

“You don’t need to apologize; I realize that I was out of line.” Stepping forward, Caitlin said, “I would like to be your friend, Amelia; and not just because you work for a talent agency. I’ve just been burned before, so I want to take things slow.”

Looking at Caitlin, feeling a little apprehensive, I said, “So, are we good?”

Reaching her hand out, Caitlin said, “We’re good.”

As I shook her hand, I said, “Give me a few minutes to wash up, then I’ll get started on dinner.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Making Amends

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The rest of the evening passed unremarkably, and I turned in about halfway through The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. My experiences have been different from my boyhood in New Jersey, I thought, but I don't think I'll have any more surprises to deal with.

With that, I fell asleep.

******************************


I found myself walking along the beach, which was deserted, though I didn't know or care why. I just enjoyed walking in the sand, as the gentle waves washed over my feet.

Some motion caught my eye, and I looked, to see someone swimming to shore. My pulse thrilled when I saw that it was Malcolm, now walking toward me through the surf.

When he reached me, I opened my mouth to say hello, but he pulled me to him and kissed me full on the mouth. I responded by running my hands over his toned body.

As we continued to kiss, he began to take off my swimsuit. I, in turn, pulled his swim trunks off of him.

When we were both naked, Malcolm gently guided me down on my back, then he climbed on top of me. As we made love, I could feel the pleasure building within me, greater and greater, until...

I had had maybe one or two orgasms wake me up when I was Kevin, but they were nothing like what I felt now. I felt it, not just in my sex, but also in my breasts, in the way my lips tingled.

As I lay there in bed, two things became crystal clear to me: I was most definitely attracted to guys now, and I was one of those lucky women who were capable of multiple orgasms.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: That Night

111111111311111112.content:
"So, what's next?" I asked, after I finally figured out how to do my hair and makeup. "Shall we check out the spa in this hotel?"

"There'll be time enough for that tomorrow," Leslie said. "You don't need to get the works done to see your parents. I just thought we'd - oh!"

"What is it? Are you okay?"

In reply, Leslie took my hand and held it to her belly. The baby kicked.

"Oh, my," I said. I'd always been interested in pregnant women, but it meant more to me now, since it could happen to me now.

"I thought you might like that," Leslie said. "This little guy drives me crazy sometimes, but he makes up for it."

"It's a boy, huh? How about that?"

"We're going to raise him better than I was, so he won't repeat my mistakes."

"I wish you well. You were saying before?"

"Oh, yeah. I thought I'd keep you loose with your next lesson in womanhood: the chick flick."

So we watched a couple of movies. Back when I was Kevin, I would have turned up my nose at these movies, since they didn't have nearly enough explosions to keep me interested. Now, though, I responded to the emotions presented on the screen. I was glad I wasn't wearing heavy makeup, or my tears would've meant a total disaster.
111111111311111112.title: Later On (After the lessons)

1111111114.content:
"I think I'll go with the man, option D please." I said with a nervous smile.

I considered the other options but I couldn't see it in my mind. A 5 year old girl? Did I really want to grow up again? what if I hated that life and did it all for nothing. the 13 year old boy I cast out almost immediately. I'd already been a 13 year old boy once and hated it. even if I changed the gender it was too similar to what I was leaving behind. I paused on the 26 year old woman. could I really be a woman? I was intrigued but after remembering the struggles my mom went through as I grew up, I didn't want to risk that kind of life. that left the older man and woman. I thought about Duncan and how happy he looked as Helen. He had become Helen based of a desire to be more like his grandmother. That wasn't for me. that left one option. I would become a man's man and shake off the legacy my Dad left me. I wanted a family that had a loving father, who was always there for his children. even if I had to build that family myself.

Dr. Willard smiled seeing my nervousness. " Are you sure? Once we do this there is no turning back. "

I knew I was making the right decision. " I'm sure Doctor."

" Then Congratulations Kevin, you’ve just made one of the biggest decisions in your life." she said jotting a note on my file. She looked up and saw my face. " Kevin, forgive me, but you don't look as happy as I thought."

"That is to be expected. You have a whole new life ahead of you. I am certain we will help you design an amazing life." Dr. Willard said kindly. "Now if you are ready, I will take you down the hall to our life designers and one of them will help you design your dream life." Dr. Willard motioned for me to follow and she led me down the hall to an office room where the lights where turned off. "Oh dear, I didn't realize the time. they are all at lunch. Kevin, please follow me we will go to the waiting room. they should be done with their lunch shortly."

We walked down a hallway I hadn't been down yet. "Um Dr. Willard, wasn't the waiting room back that way?" I said slightly confused.

"that was the intake waiting room. you are in the process of becoming someone else, so we have a separate and bit more confidential waiting room back here. That way if someone isn't deemed unsatisfied enough, they wont know you have been here by seeing you in passing." we arrived at a door at the end of the hallway where another hallway intersected perpendicular to it. A Life Designer will be down shortly collect you."

I walked into the VIP waiting room and took a seat. the seats where much nicer than the intake room. There were a few other Clients in the room also waiting. Everyone looked nervous, but were smiling as we waited for our new life.
1111111114.title: I'm Going to Be the Man

11111111141.content:
A few minutes after taking my seat, the door opened and Life Designers began to pull clients out of the waiting room until it was only me. I glanced around the empty room. A decorative mirror hung on the wall opposite the door. It reflected light that hit my eyes in an uncomfortable way, so I got up and walked over to it. My reflection peered back at me. It had been my constant companion and I was about to give it up for a new one.

"Saying goodbye Mr. Scott?" A voice said, startling me.

"I. uh...." I stammered as I turned around to see a young woman in the door way. "Call me... uh Kevin. I was just... uh"

"Don't worry about it, that is what it is there for. I am Leslie Cummings, your Life Designer. It is a pleasure to meet you." Leslie said. "If you would follow me, we will go to my work station and figure out what kind of body and life you would like to lead.

That solution will both have a sedative and contain a cocktail of nanobots which will have been programmed based on the contents of the files you and Leslie created. Then while you are asleep the nanobots will get to work changing your body and mind giving you the traits, skills, and knowledge to lead your new life. Sound good?"

I nodded an affirmative. "alright then, before we get started is there anything else you need to do as Kevin Scott? any phone calls or last goodbyes, Or is there anything of Kevin that you want to keep? if not everything on you will be sent back to the Scott family."

I remembered the envelope that Kelsey had given me. "Um, this envelope that has pictures of my twin sister" I said pulling it from a pocket.

"Put it in the tray, and take these. strip out of everything and put that robe on. And I do mean everything." she said slightly sticking her tongue out as she jokingly handed me the robe.

" Alright, then when you next wake up you will be Mr. David Williams officially. Happy Birthday." she said as she hit a button on the computer. The I.V. started to drip and my last conscious thought was of Liz humming Happy Birthday.

When I turned back around Kyle and David were gone. "sure thing." I said. my voice a bit deeper, more mature. "oh what about this one Dad." I was closer to moms age, although she wasn't my mom anymore. " that was fun maybe next time we can watch a movie" I heard as an echo as the living-room and Abigail dissolved.

I saw my first kiss. high school and college, my first solo project. faster and faster images came until a wall of light appeared and I entered through it.

I awoke on a hospital bed. Liz siting behind the computer blowing bubble gum that matched her hair color.
"morning sunshine. Happy Birthday David." she grinned. I smiled feeling the five o'clock shadow on my face. with my hand I brushed the whiskers, grinning at the possibiity of growing a full beard if I wanted to.

"I got you some clothes" Liz said walking towards me with bundle wrapped under her arms. "once you're dressed we will get you ready to be discharged and you will be on your way Mr. Williams."

I got dressed quickly. I was strangely cold so I spent almost no time looking at my new self. I through on a pair of khakis and dress socks, a white t-shirt and a blue dress shirt and dark red tie. I finished it off by putting on a pair of plain oxford shoes. It didnt even click that I knew what I was wearing and how to put it all on effortlessly.

Liz walked me to the discharge counter. Dr. Harris was waiting for me. "Dr. Harris hello, thank you so much." I said putting my hand forth.

I hope she got to see her sister off alright." I thought to myself. I sat in thought for several minutes before I realized another person had entered the room. A young woman had sat in a chair in the corner and was staring at me. I looked up and smiled. she averted her eyes and mumbled an apology. " It's quite alright miss." I said. "poor girl" I thought "she looks like she has had it rough. hopefully she can get a fresh start."

Teens either laughing or wishing desperately to be somewhere else. The hot tub filled with parents wishing they were elsewhere while trying to keep one eye on there kids. The room as a whole was just a series of never ending echoes. I tried to smile for myself. This is what I had wanted. As kevin I had loved the pool though mom was never a fan. 1111111114111122.content:
I gave up on going out and exploring as I changed out of my swimsuit. It was getting late and my day had been unforgettably busy. I ordered take-out Chinese food and had it delivered to my room. Soon after finishing my meal I fell asleep to the drone of television.

Waking up with the sun was a novel experience. As Kevin, I had tried to sleep as long as possible, but as soon as the sunlight reached my window I stirred. Groggy I got up and took a shower. Once cleaned up and dressed I still couldn't shake the grogginess from my head, and a growl from my stomach told me I was hungry. I peered into the rooms mini-fridge at the take-out food, but my stomach wouldn't accept it. It was then that I realized how early it was. The hotel would have breakfast.

The breakfast room was on the main floor off the lobby. As I exited the elevator the smell of coffee cleared my head. My stomach growled again as if saying "that is what we want". I gathered a full plate breakfast food and a cup of coffee and found a small table in the corner of the room. I watched older couples sit and slowly gnawed on their breakfast, while business men rushed in grabbing a piece of toast and quickly returned to the lobby. Occasionally I got up to refill my coffee cup, and with each cup began to feel more awake. I found a newspaper on one of the tables and became engrossed in the business section, especially with an article on building trends in the mid--west.


Later on I returned to my room. I spotted the note that I had been sent when New Horizon had sent me clothes. The Idea of meeting with several beautiful women for a few hours sounded like fun. I did however a few hours to kill before they would be off work.

To kill time I found the hotel gym. It was a relatively small room, set back behind the pool area. Three treadmills, an arm hoist and a squat rack was about it for machines, though several free weight racks lined the walls. Seeing the room empty, I stepped on to a treadmill. I had never been into fitness before but after trying the treadmill, I couldn't think of why I ever didn’t like fitness. I ran for miles with no problem. After seeing the five mile mark hit I really began to appreciate how fit my new life was. I would have been heaving for air after a mile as Kevin, but now I was warmed up and ready to hit the racks.

Sweat was pouring down my forehead when the gym door opened. I looked up as the woman from the elevator last night walked in. This time she wore spandex pants and a loose t-shirt with her hair pulled up into a high ponytail. I averted my eyes as she noticed me. I was determined to not be caught staring a second time.

Deciding to be macho, I put a few more weights on the rack just in case she was watching, and was rewarded with a smile when she noticed. The woman then stepped onto a treadmill and began to run. My eyes drifted towards her, but when I saw her looking I quickly focused on my own work out. After an hour of working out I could feel the fatigue set in. Once I finished my set I began to put the weights back onto a rack. The woman stopped her own set and smiled at me.
“I saw you last night didn’t I?” she said. Her voice, smooth and welcoming.

“Uh yeah. I had just arrived and was heading to the pool”

“Oof. how did it go?”

“It was loud, a bit chaotic. I didn't stay long.” I said playing it cool.

“I’m Diana,” she said, stepping forward to shake my hand.

“David”

“It is nice to meet you David. How long are you here for?” Diana asked casually. Though there was an interest in her eyes and I noticed she looked down at my hand.

“I fly home Saturday morning”

“Oh me too. Hey, I can see that you are getting ready to go so I won’t hold you up but if you are not busy Friday night I will be up in the Upstairs Bar. If you want to join me, I certainly wouldn't mind the company” Diana said handing me a small card that had her name and what I assumed was her phone number on it.

“Thanks.” I said putting her card into my pocket. “I’ll see you then.” and left for the door, surprised that on day two and my first full day as David I was already having better luck with the ladies than I had ever had as Kevin.
